data.title: Adored every moment of our visit!
data.text: We spent one night at the Burr House B&B, and we loved it from start to finish!  The exterior and interior are well kept and adorable to boot.  The room was clean and tidy along with the private bathroom.  The house was quiet as well as the neighborhood.  The breakfast was delicious, and the company and conversation during breakfast were even better.  Thank you Mary Ann for a wonderful stay!  We hope to come back soon. :)

data.title: Delightful
data.text: This is a dandy B&B in a hostoric century home. We stayed two nights, going and coming back, and were in different rooms each night. Both were huge--one even had ita own separate living room. Lovely grounds (which you are free to enjoy), comfortable, quiet, free wifi, a fine breakfast. Highly recommended.

data.title: Wonderful B&B!
data.text: We stayed here two nights - once on the way to Kansas and once on the way back. Our first stay was in the Sunset room which was delightful. It was huge with a private whirlpool bath - and shower. Our second night was in the Queen Anne suite, which was even bigger - with a delightful sitting room in addition to the bedroom. This is a beautiful 1860s house that is beautifully maintained with lots of history - ask the wonderful hostess Mary. She was extremely welcoming and lovely. Breakfast was terrific. The grounds are also a delight. Strongly recommend!

data.title: Wonderful B&B
data.text: This was a welcome one night stay for two weary cross country travelers.  The house and rooms were charming and well-kept and we had the best breakfast of the trip.  The owner Mary Anne has a wealth of info about the area and its history and really goes out of her way to make you feel at home.

data.title: Fantastic Stay!
data.text: We were so blessed with the wonderful stay at The Burr House.  The Queen Anne Suite is beautiful and has a large, private bathroom; SO NICE!!  Mary Ann, the owner, is a warm and caring hostess, and tailors the breakfast to accommodate any food allergies and preferences guests may have.  Delicious homemade breakfast and conversation here!  Thank you so much!!

data.title: Cozy, Clean, and Well-Cared For!
data.text: We had the pleasure of staying one night last week at The Burr House in the Sunset Room.  The room was lovely and our host, Mary Anne, very congenial.  We'll definitely go stay there again when next in Bloomington.

data.title: Lovely
data.text: I spent two nights at the Burr House and enjoyed my stay very much. I could not have asked for a better place. Very clean and comfy rooms. The location is great - in DT Bloomington - and getting to/from Normal is easy (both walking and taking the bus). Besides the location and the atmosphere of the house, I appreciated the great service most. Mary Ann prepared my very own breakfast on both days and has been a great host. I would stay at the Burr House anytime - no question about it!

data.title: Wonderful overnight stay!!!
data.text: Great location on a pretty park in a historic neighborhood.  Mary Anne was a wonderful and knowledgable innkeeper. We had the Best French toast for breakfast. We were Walking distance to Lucas's for great pizza. Comfortable rooms and beds.

data.title: Warm welcome, wonderful stay
data.text: I stayed at Burr House while in Bloomington on business.  What a luxury to stay in this historic B and B.  The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was homemade with the added benefit on interesting company. Highly recommend it.

data.title: Business Traverer
data.text: I stay at the Burr House Tuesday and Wednesday nights, in that I have a hour drive home from work, and staying here breaks up my week of driving. I stay in the Sunset Room, but next week I am moving on up to the Crow' Next, they both have private baths, the house is very quiet, Franklin Park right across the street, I walk it for some exercise, situated in a Historical neighborhood with many grand houses. Can walk to downtown. Mary Ann is a great host, and we talk each morning, in that I am a Chef and so is she, and I also run a Guest House, so we are never short on discussion.

data.title: Like my another home
data.text: I stayed here for 3 nights in safari room. It is my first b&b experience, and I think I am so lucky to have this chance to stay here. Mary Ann gave me a lot of help, and provided the best services. The breakfast was perfect, and she always asked me what i liked. I love to talk with her, because she told me a lot of things during the conversation. Also, it was my first time to Bloomington, and she told me that there were many places for me to visit. And also she sent me to the amtrak station so that my friend in class did not need to take me there. I can't wait to come back for visiting again, because it gives me a lot of memories in this house. Mary Ann is a really great host. Trust me, it is really valuable to stay here.

data.title: Excellent service, very clean beautiful home!
data.text: I reserved a few rooms for a conference. Could not have been happier with the service. Our staff loved the rooms! They were large and super clean. The food was excellent and the host was kind and really nice. We will use their services again for sure!

data.title: Like staying in your grandma's wonderful old home in Bloomington that's close to everything
data.text: We wanted a place near downtown so that we could enjoy dinner and the Pokey Lafarge show at the Castle theater. The Burr House was perfect! It is on a quiet street just a few blocks from downtown in a beautiful neighborhood facing a park. The house has been updated to modern standards, yet it maintains homey (rather than formal) quality that made us feel comfortable. Our room, the Sunset room, was spacious with a large bathroom. It was quiet, and our one-night stay was restful. The home-cooked breakfast was, again, homey instead of formal. The portions were just right for us--I enjoy a hearty breakfast without wasting food or feeling gross afterwards. If you want to enjoy a gracious old home, the Burr House is for you.

data.title: A Bloomington Gem
data.text:
The Burr House Bed & Breakfast is a delightful place.  The home itself is charming and has exquisite features including original woodworking, marble fireplaces and more.  The rooms are wonderful and the beds comfortable.  Sitting at the dining room in the morning and watching birds out the window, enjoying a well lit sitting room off of our room and the quietness in their to take in some much appreciated reading.  The breakfasts are good and the host is dear.

The location is wonderful.  It is just blocks from Illinois Wesleyan and the down town area of Bloomington which as some nice restaurants.  You are close to the performing arts area, just off of historic Route 66, and minutes away from Illinois State and downtown Normal.

The house is right across the street from Franklin Plaza, a park that reminds me of a square you would see in England - it spans a good city block and has wonderful old trees, park benches and a play ground.

data.title: Generally Pleasant
data.text: A nice location for a weekend in Bloomington.  Right by Franklin Park and a short walk to downtown.  The lady of the house is rather charming -- not the most outgoing personality, but knowledgable about the area.  Her husband is in the entirely wrong business -- describing him as a curmedgeon is being polite.  The place does have the look of a dowager and could use a good deep cleaning.  But still all in all it is a pleasant stay in a town otherwise filled with horrible cheap chain hotels.

data.title: A Quiet Comfortable Place with Tasty Breakfasts
data.text: Two-night stay in early April. Great location on Franklin Park. Queen Anne's suite cannot be beat. The other interesting guests and the affable host, Maryann, made this a delightful stay. Little street traffic and a second fool view of the park.

data.title: Burr House Bloomington
data.text: If you are going to spend a night or more in Bloomington/Normal Illinois, and you want to try something other than a chain hotel/motel, I recommend that you try The Burr House Bed & Breakfast.  It is in a quiet neighborhood near Illinois Wesleyan University (two blocks away).  The accomodations are fine, as long as you don't want a big screen tv in your room.  It is less expensive than the chain hotels/motels, and the breakfast is much better.  Maryann, the proprietor, is very welcoming and helpful.  I recommend giving it a try if you are in town.

data.title: Quintessential B & B
data.text: Loved our stay. Our Host was very welcoming. Rooms were well appointed. Had great privacy. Breakfast was delicious. Company at the table sublime. Great access to downtown and Illinois Weslyan. Top marks all the way around!!! Even shared conversation with a Prince on the status the European Union!!!

data.title: Basic Accommodations - Great Atmosphere
data.text: My daughter and I stayed one night.  Maryann, the host, was extremely helpful at every turn.  Affordable, quiet, excellent food.  House in need of some upkeep (non-functiong lamp in my room - but there were 3 others that worked) Highly recommended

data.title: Friendly, but dusty!
data.text:
My husband and I stayed at the Burr House while visiting friends for a quick weekend in Bloomington. The neighborhood is very quaint and the outside of the home is beautiful. The innkeeper is very sweet. The location is convenient. 

My only problems include:
-dingy looking sheets
-flat,limp pillows
-dust everywhere and the place could use a deep cleaning, I believe
